id="content-container"><section class="content-body grid-75"><div dehydrated="<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview"></a></h2>
<p>In order to process the transaction, you have to use the <a href="https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/payout/VisaDirect/ProcessTransaction" target="" title="">https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/payout/VisaDirect/ProcessTransaction</a> endpoint. In order to do so, you will need to generate an RSA key with the instructions below.</p>
<blockquote class="callout callout_info" theme="📘"><h2 class="callout-heading"><span class="callout-icon">📘</span><p>Generate RSA Key</p></h2><p>Please see <a href="https://docs.payper.ca/reference/generate-rsa-key" target="" title="">https://docs.payper.ca/reference/generate-rsa-key</a> for instructions on how to generate an RSA key pair for encrypting the PAN and CVV values before sending this request.</p><p>Encrypt the values with UTF8 encoding, RSA encryption padding with <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">RSA/ECB/OAEPWithSHA-1AndMGF1</code> cipher type and converted to a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">Base64</code> string.</p><p>Please use this tool to help with testing encryption using this cipher type: <a href="https://www.devglan.com/online-tools/rsa-encryption-decryption" target="" title="">https://www.devglan.com/online-tools/rsa-encryption-decryption</a></p></blockquote>
<blockquote class="callout callout_info" theme="📘"><h2 class="callout-heading empty"><span class="callout-icon">📘</span></h2><p>Refer to <a href="https://docs.payper.ca/reference/process-visa-direct" target="" title="">Visa Direct</a> for more information on this endpoint.</p></blockquote>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="request"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-request" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Request</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Request" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#request"></a></h2>

     &quot;ntf_url&quot;: &quot;https://notification.url/&quot;,

}

  &quot;status&quot;: &quot;approved&quot;,
  &quot;tx_action&quot;: &quot;payout&quot;,
  &quot;card_id&quot;: 1002,
  &quot;txid&quot;: &quot;30055317283286874987777889094&quot;,

<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="postbacks"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-postbacks" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Postbacks</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Postbacks" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#postbacks"></a></h2>
<p>When Payper receives a request, Payper will send 2 postbacks to the notification endpoint you provide for <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">ntf_url</code>. A postback indicates that a change has been to the object referenced in the event, such as changes to the transaction action and status. For more information on how to set up postbacks, refer to <a href="/docs/conditions-for-sending-webhooks" target="" title="" class="doc-link" data-sidebar="conditions-for-sending-webhooks">Conditions for sending webhooks</a>.</p>

Processing a Visa Direct Transaction
Overview

In order to process the transaction, you have to use the https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/payout/VisaDirect/ProcessTransaction endpoint. In order to do so, you will need to generate an RSA key with the instructions below.

📘

Generate RSA Key

Please see https://docs.payper.ca/reference/generate-rsa-key for instructions on how to generate an RSA key pair for encrypting the PAN and CVV values before sending this request.

Encrypt the values with UTF8 encoding, RSA encryption padding with RSA/ECB/OAEPWithSHA-1AndMGF1 cipher type and converted to a Base64 string.

Please use this tool to help with testing encryption using this cipher type: https://www.devglan.com/online-tools/rsa-encryption-decryption

📘

Refer to Visa Direct for more information on this endpoint.

Request
JSON
{
     "txid": "30055317283286874987777889094",
     "email": "Brandon@Martin.com",
     "ntf_url": "https://notification.url/",
     "card_id": 1234,
     "encrypted_pan": "A7GaMLUVOhbRoJZWJ/RADzylZmIEHlRasdfas",
     "encrypted_verification_code": "SPk2YsWV5wdAJHpR7dp8VXFx8nqP+FNf0hbCad3n20K1xy132I+G+0xToMQvstJWa1uzY",
     "rsa_key_id": 1001,
     "expiration_month": "06",
     "expiration_year": "2025"
}

Response
JSON
{
  "amount": 1,
  "descriptor": "VisaDirectMoneySend",
  "message": "VisaDirect payout transaction approved",
  "status": "approved",
  "tx_action": "payout",
  "card_id": 1002,
  "txid": "30055317283286874987777889094",
  "udfs": [
    "udf1",
    "udf2"
  ]
}

Postbacks

When Payper receives a request, Payper will send 2 postbacks to the notification endpoint you provide for ntf_url. A postback indicates that a change has been to the object referenced in the event, such as changes to the transaction action and status. For more information on how to set up postbacks, refer to Conditions for sending webhooks.

First Postback

Here's an example of the first postback. Refer to Postback Notifications for more information.

Second Postback

Here's an example of the second postback. Refer to Postback Notifications for more information.
